intro: Kontumia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf kontumia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either simple or lobed depending on environmental conditions. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators.
